sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The sorrowful citizen; or, The couragious plovv-man. With the witty answer of a country damosel. You citizens I pray beware, that does this story hear; dote not too much on beauty fair, lest this may prove your share. To the tune of, The country farmer. This may be printed, R.P.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for J. Blare, at the sign of the Looking-Glass, on London-Bridge, [London] : [between 1685-1688]
Date and place of publication suggested by Wing. Verse: "A Londoner into the country went ..." Item at A5:2[338] trimmed. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
=======
